txt.en: 'We have driven them from this place, and they will not return.'
'My friends, we have come to Barad Rath in sorrow for the loss of three of our own.'
'You could always count on Colhamnir for a laugh, no matter the situation.'
'Their names will be always remembered: Tadan, Colhamnir, Carchammadel.'
'I remember once when I was cleaning a vase, it slipped from my fingers and shattered.'
'Forchon, if you would begin.'
'Colhamnir wanted to bury the pieces, so I would have an 'ancient relic' to dig up days hence.'
'He laughed and laughed.'
'The air is chill, and my heart is heavy with sorrow. All battles bring grief in their train, but beyond the veil of sadness lies the hope of victory.'

'Torogethir has done as he said he would, for this is his raven, Fleet-wing. Amarthiel's troops are leaving this land by the Evendim Gate.\n\n'We must depart this place, [placeholder]. I thank you for attending my people, and for your part in the remembrance of our fallen kin.'

'Let us leave Barad Rath, [placeholder]. I hope one day to return here to the cairns of Tadan, Carchammadel, and Colhamnir and share with them news of our victory over Angmar and its treacherous regent.'
'The cap-stone for Tadan's cairn is all that remains, [placeholder].'
'[placeholder], I have a request of you.'
You place the cap-stone on the cairn of Ranger Carchammadel
'We go now to build cairns over our fallen kinsmen, Dúnedain all.'
You place the cap-stone on the cairn of Ranger Colhamnir
'I want you to place the cap-stone on each of the cairns, [placeholder].'
You place the cap-stone on the cairn of Ranger Tadan
'I know that you are of [placeholder]-kind, and no Dúnadan, but...'
'[placeholder], if you would, place the final stone on Carchammadel's cairn.'
'No words of mine can do justice to Tadan's memory, and for that I am sorry.'
'I feel that this is right. Our people must stand together, even in grief.'
'He volunteered always for the thankless tasks, with no thought for himself.'
'The world will be poorer without him in it.'
'Be at peace, my brother.'
You have come with Calenglad to Barad Rath to remember the Rangers slain during Mordrambor's escape from Tinnudir.
'A bird! A messenger-raven!'
Talk to Calenglad
'Wait... look there!'
'This is Fleet-wing, the raven of Torogethir!'
'I did not have the opportunity to know Carchammadel very well.'
Follow Calenglad to Barad Rath
'Amarthiel's forces are marching through the Evendim Gate.'
'I curse Angmar for depriving me of it!'
Take your place next to Cuguminuial
'It has begun.'
'What is that?'
Watch the building of the cairn
Place cap-stone on the cairn for Carchammadel
'I knew Carchammadel for many years before we came to Evendim.'
Watch the building of the cairn
'She spoke often of Annúminas.'
Place cap-stone on the cairn for Colhamnir
'I wish she could have seen it retaken.'
Watch the building of the cairn
Place cap-stone on the cairn for Tadan
Listen to Calenglad
'Stand by Cuguminuial, if you would, [placeholder].'
'[placeholder], it is time.'
'Our losses have been severe, our pain great.'
'What news of the tomb-robbers?'
'But the Dúnedain fight on!'
'Astiul, if you please.'
'Carchammadel used to come here often to admire the sunsets, before Angmar came.'
'I am glad you have returned from the city, my friends.'
'Do not despair, Cuguminuial. Our friends will always be with us.'
'Colhamnir was quick to laugh, but he knew the importance of strength.'
Calenglad is on the slope by Barad Rath.\n\nThe Dúnedain have come to Barad Rath to remember their fallen, and Calenglad is waiting to walk with you to the site.
'We will avenge you, my friend. Angmar will fear the wrath of the Dúnedain!'
The Dúnedain have come to Barad Rath to mourn the loss of their kin.
'[placeholder], the cap-stone for Colhamnir's cairn, please.'
The Dúnedain have come to Barad Rath to mourn the loss of their kin.
The Dúnedain are waiting for you to place the cap-stone on the cairn for Carchammadel.
The Dúnedain have come to Barad Rath to mourn the loss of their kin.
The Dúnedain are waiting for you to place the cap-stone on the cairn for Colhamnir.
The Dúnedain have come to Barad Rath to mourn the loss of their kin.
The Dúnedain are waiting for you to place the cap-stone on the cairn for Tadan.
The Dúnedain have come to Barad Rath to mourn the loss of their kin.
Fleet-wing brings a dreaded, but expected, message: Amarthiel's troops have begun passing through the Evendim Gate in search of Narchuil.
'There will always be losses in war...'
'And yet, there is one among us who can put an end to our long sorrow.'
'The line of kings remains unbroken, and with that knowledge, our fallen kin will be at peace.'
'Cuguminuial, please.'
Instance: Remembrance
